vectorData.altText: 1. Name the serous membrane that covers surface A. Be specific.
That's right!  The exterior surface of the heart is covered with visceral pericardium.
That is incorrect. Click here      to learn the answer, then come back to try again.
of the pericardial sac. It is smooth and slippery, unlike the outer surface of the pericardial sac.

This is because the pericardial sac is composed of two fused layers, an outer fibrous layer and an inner serous layer (see section 2.4 for a description of serous membranes).  
The serous membrane lining the inner surface of the fibrous pericardium is the parietal portion of the serous pericardium (analogous to the parietal pleura).
TOUCH the surface of the heart.
The heart is covered by the same serous membrane, but here it is called the visceral portion of the serous pericardium (analogous to the visceral pleura).
